results.description:
We'll hold our 'holiday run-up period' event on Voltaire's Birthday, SATURDAY November 21, at Philips Brooks House, and view the 2015 film, "An Honest Liar" about the life of the famous magician, escape artist, and world-renowned enemy of deception, James ‘The Amazing’ Randi. We'll meet at 1 pm to view this film together, with some drinks provided. Feel free to bring snacks (popcorn!).

The film brings to life James Randi’s intricate investigations that publicly exposed psychics, faith healers, and con-artists with quasi-religious fervor. We'll view this film with an appreciative and skeptic eye, then discuss the relation of magic and deception to science and truth, as well as human foibles and how they influence our work and our humanistic world views. 


NOTE: We are using GBH funds to pay for the right to show this film (via Tugg), to you for FREE: your membership/support money at work. Thanks!


More on the film: This 2015 feature film showcases the life of a master deceiver who came out of the closet at the age of 81; Randi created fictional characters, fake psychics, and even turned his partner of 25 years, the artist Jose Alvarez, into a sham guru named Carlos. But when a shocking revelation in Randi’s personal life is discovered, it isn’t clear whether Randi is still the deceiver – or the deceived.

The film holds a 97% score on the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, based on 34 reviews. The film was a Critics' Pick of The New York Times, for which reviewer Jeannette Catsoulis called the film a "jaunty, jovial portrait with a surprising sting in its tail".

Free PARKING WILL in fact be available in the Littauer Lot of Harvard University near the Science Center (Enter the Dworkin Science Quadrangle from Oxford St. and proceed to the end of the road to the parking area near the Science Center behind Littauer Library. If nervous, leave a note in your dashboard that you are at the Humanist event at PBH.)
results.name: November Film and Discussion: An Honest Liar

results.description:
Are you looking for ways to improve your photography?

Are you not sure how to approach a new subject or scene to get the best results?

Folks don’t think twice about hitting the gym to workout out their bodies. How about joining us for a workout for your photography “muscles”?  This workshop is a hands-on learning experience!

In this workshop you will be given three different photo assignments.  Each "assignment" will include instruction, followed by time for photography.  The goal is to get you to practice one theme/subject/skill at a time and to get creative with your photography. 

This is a good workshop for photographers of all skill levels.  The assignments are designed to build skills and improve your photography. As you shoot each "assignment"  your instructor will be on hand to guide your photography. The sequence of the assignments are related and will develop your photo skill set.

After each shoot we will re-group, review and then move on to our next assignment.


We will be shooting around the Faneuil Hall and Haymarket areas of downtown Boston. This historic area ideal for photography, with it's easy walking conditions, having lots of color and dynamic subjects to capture with your camera.

In this workshop we  emphasize the design of your photography.  Each assignment is built on a theme or composition element.  This workshop is all about expanding your creativity and improving  the look of your photos.

Join us on Saturday Nov. 21 from 1:30 pm to 4:00 pm for this photo workshop. This class is all about making good photos  and exploring the details and sights of Boston.  Consider the assignments  as a challenge and source of inspiration for your photo creativity.

We will meet in front of Faneuil Hall at the Sam Adams Statue (1 Faneuil Hall Square, Boston, MA) and  will spend 2.5 hours walking and working on our "assignments". LINK TO MAP FOR MEET-UP LOCATION
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the Sam Adams Statue in front of Faneuil Hall- Link to map: https://goo.gl/maps/TypDAzyzw1H2
results.name: Creative Photography Workshop – A hands on photography experience

results.description:
Texture is the most enduring and ubiquitous underpinning of form creating a calming, meditative and appealing world for both the eye and mind. (Lynda Lehmann)

All levels welcome to attend. If you are wondering why I am going to repeat this field trip again next weekend, the answer is simple. Just look at the photos posted by the participants that attended last weekend!  Click on the gallery for the past meet up and be prepared to be inspired. We have 6 people on the wait list for last week so now is your chance to attend if you missed out last weekend.  I hope you can secure a spot this time. Very sorry not to be able to include you last week. I find everyone learns more if I keep the group small for some of the sessions. 

The variety of textures available in this small space will keep us very busy for 3 hours. We will do 3 different assignments to help you see light, improve composition, and choose camera setting to capture detail and depth.


Wild Wind and sunlight moving through the grasses of the marsh.


Seeing the beauty of the marsh requires slowing down and noticing the more subtle colors, and textures. I went on an overcast day and it was low tide, not ideal conditions. Still I was delighted with the intriguing images I was able to capture and you can too.  One of the skills of taking your photography to the next level is to be able to take better photos in all lighting conditions.

Even if you have visited this nature reserve before, I think you will see it with fresh eyes as a result of this workshop.  We will delve into the visual characteristics that result in more dramatic compositions. 

Look how many different layers of texture you can capture in a single image. The tide was out this day, but will be in when we visit this weekend.

You can see the Boston Skyline in the distance. 

There are also many subjects that would be excellent from closeup and macro shots. Bring your tripod if you have one. Tripod is also good to capture the end of day photos as the light changes.


During this workshop we will focus on:

• Best camera settings for capturing the details of a variety of textures in one shot.

• New composition strategies for dramatic and subtle landscapes that evoke a mood and tell a story.

• How to use design elements of symmetrical and asymmetrical composition to achieve balance and wholeness.

• How to adjust your camera setting if you want to work in aperture and shutter priority. ( I will do a special talk for a small group of you who want extra time on this topic. I will walk you through taking your camera off Auto and help you understand the relationship between ISO, Aperture and Shutter priority.)

• More advanced participants will work on creative seeing assignments for making  your images more interesting and captivating using dynamic tension.


One fun aspect of this location, it is  right beneath a flight path to Logan. Depending on the direction of the wind this path may be active. If you want to turn your camera toward the sky.... . 

This week is easy walking, flat paths. Wear boots if you plan to leave the path and venture into the marsh. Located 5 minutes from the Suffolk Downs T stop on the Blue line. And there is plenty of free parking. 

End of day blast of bright sunlight changed everything in an instant.  I hope to see you there on Saturday. Just RSVP now to get a spot in the class. I am keeping the group small again this week so I can spend extra time with each of you.

Suzanne

We had a end of day surprise sunset well worth the wait. You never know. It might happen again for us this Saturday. 

Soft pastel colors on the marsh after sunset. House on the marsh catching the light.

results.name: Return to The Beauty & Mystery of  Belle Isle Marsh: Focus on Texture and Light

Article about the park can be found here: http://www.wbur.org/2015/10/27/lynch-family-skate-park-opening

The park is located beneath the on-ramps to the Zakim Bridge so lighting might be a challenge. I suggest you bring a speed light or two if you have them to accentuate your subjects. I may well bring a soft box on a painter's pole (all I'll need is a VALS).

Let's meet at the entrance to North Point Park directly across from the Museum of Science parking lot at 2:00. Plenty of parking there or take the Green Line Lechmere branch to the Science Park stop. There's other interesting stuff in the area as well, including some great perspectives from under the Zakim Bridge. If the weather cooperates, this could be a fun afternoon!

New players are welcome. If you've never played before, there is a learning scenario we can do first. Thus, any new players should arrive at noon (two hours earlier) to learn the rules and play out the introduction scenario.

results.description:
Inspired by Martijn van Exel (OSM hacker and secretary of OpenStreetMap US), OSM-Boston is doing a "Flash Map Mob"  at Assembly Row in Somerville Saturday Nov 21.

For this event we'll use mobile platforms - smartphones, tablets or (if you prefer) pen and paper - to record and directly update OpenStreetMap. We meet at J.P. Licks ice cream bar, divide the area up, and walk around fixing and adding any missing features to the map.

This is a quick and simple way to learn how to contribute to OpenStreetMap. If you plan on using a smartphone or tablet, the following apps work well for directly editing OpenStreetMap:

• Vespucci (Android)

• GoMap!! (iOS)

No prior experience needed - Beginners as well as pros are welcome!
results.name: Flash Map Mob at Assembly Row

results.description:
This informal  book for discussion will be from an author we love, Vanessa Diffenbaugh, author of Secret Language of Flowers,(which we have read previously)   and her new title We Never Asked for Wings.

We Never Asked for Wings:

For fourteen years ,Letty Espinosa has worked three jobs around San Francisco to make ends meet while her mother raises her children, Alex, 15, and Luna 6, in their tiny apartment on a forgotten spit of wetlands near the bay.  But now Letty's parents are returning to Mexico, and Letty must step up and become a mother for the first time in her life. 

Vanessa Diffenbaugh blends gorgeous prose with compelling themes of motherhood, undocumented immigration, and the American Dream in a powerful and prescient story about family.

Please come join us if you've read this new novel and would like to discuss. Its very informal, with a snack and bottled water.

see you soon!!!

Come join us!

results.description:
We will meet for another light painting project where everybody can contribute and participate, either in one large or several smaller groups. The theme of the night is "Alien Wars", think futuristic hybrid of Star Trek and Star Wars with some X-Men, Avengers and a dash of Interstellar mixed in. Roswell alien crash site, anyone? Your fantasy is the limit.


Alien Slinky Prancing Around.


Take a look at Lisa's recent meetup to get the idea and look up Jan Leonardo's or Martin Barras' work to see how advanced this can get.

Bring lots of light gadgets, the more outrageous, the better, but keep in mind that they need to be fairly dim, the super-bright million candle lights don't work for this. Colorful is good and if it spins, moves or can be tossed, all the better. There will be a price for the most inventive self-made gadget!

Jan Leonardo Wöllert's MOTUS FIGHTER.


Camera, tripod, intervalometer/remote for long exposures and wide angle lenses. Dress in dark clothing so that you won't show up in the image (you can still be made visible by shining a light on you). Bring sturdy hiking shoes, the terrain will be uneven and your pants are likely to get dirty.


This is an advanced night photography shoot, please make sure that you know your camera, there will be no opportunity to go through basic settings.


Sunset is at 4:18, moon will be 87% full and high up in the sky, adding background illumination.


The location was chosen for plenty of space, interesting foregrounds (ponds) and backgrounds (rocks) and no direct lights. And somebody can jump down from 50 ft while swirling a light to simulate a UFO landing! (Just kidding. No really.)


Martin Barras: Wiltshire Weirdness


Let the alien fights begin....
results.name: Light Painting project: Alien Wars

I have recently been organizing a weekly Ethnic Eats MeetUP with the North Shore Women's Group, I am expanding my circle to include a more gender-diverse audience that includes places that are closer to Boston than they are to New Hampshire. This group will include the Cambridge Boston Ethnic Dining and may be a mixed gender group. 

Join me to try Moroccan food in Arlington. This is where you can find the menu:

http://www.pashaturkish.com

I typically bring my yellow Bananagrams game as a table marker for my Meetup groups. Often we play a game or three after we eat if time permits or the restaurant atmosphere allows. 

As an event organizer I also have low tolerance for no shows. Be aware that if you do not show up and do not cancel your RSVP I will not permit you to attend my events in the future. I hate eating alone and I hate waiting for ghosts...and it would be a lot of Moroccan food for the three parties of me, myself, and I. Be decent and let me know if you can't come, even if it is the day of the event.
results.how_to_find_us: RSVP's are under Renee. I will also bring my yellow bananagrams game to put on the table

results.description:
We will practice together, play and study theory.

Usually we get quite a few beginners, so if you are just starting don't be shy, you definitely can join us. If you have been playing for some time I am sure you will find a few helpful ideas as well. If the level will be very different then we might divide it to two groups eventually.

Half of the class time is dedicated to a consecutive curriculum. We try to choose themes that are relevant to everybody in the class. We might talk about some aspects of technique, or reading, or theory etc. The other half of the class time we usually help students with their individual issues and questions.

We see this class as a supportive and motivational environment for your self-teaching process. There are two experienced guitar teachers (Anastasiya Dumma and David Lee), both Berklee grads, who are ready to answer all your questions and suggest new things to practice!

This is PAY-WHAT-YOU-WANT class. We kindly ask you to support your teachers and Westland Guitars that provided the space. Online donations feel a bit inconvenient (sorry), so you can contribute when you come to the class.
results.how_to_find_us: Westland Guitars is quite easy to find, I believe. For those of you who are familiar with the area it is very close to Whole Foods (across the street) and Symphony Hall. 54B is in the basement and it has its own dedicated entrance.
results.name: Let's make one more step towards guitar mastery.

results.description:
This documentary movie was screened at the BAAFF film festival in October. This is an encore presentation. We will meet for quick & light dinner at Dong Kahn restaurant in Chinatown. Then we will head to the theatre nearby. 

The story is about Kenneth Eng's father about how he came to the U.S. and the sacrifices he made over the years. And about him going back to China to visit. This movie will resonate with many of us who are children of immigrants. The film has English subtitles as well  

Here is a quote from the director (Boston born)  

"My Life in China" is a personal film that takes viewers on a journey to rural China where an emotional revelation takes place.Every family has a special story.In America, everyone has a family story of immigration. Everyone, at some point, has had somebody in their family leave their native country behind to search for a better life.How did they hold onto their identity? How did they adapt to their new life?In my case, it's my Chinese-American story.


Movie starts at 7:30 pm. Meet for dinner at 6 pm.

Tix are $10 at the door or $7.50 in advance & $5 for students w/ ID. 

Here is the link to purchase tix in advance online and more info about the film  

www.baaff.org

And more info about the documentary.

Meet at New Dong Kahn at 6 pm. Address is 83 Harrison Ave, Chinatown.
results.name: Dinner & Movie "My Life in China"

group.name: The Boston Asian Professionals Meetup Group

results.description:
Let's see what Katniss does next!

The movie time is 7:15, I will arrive at the theater by 6:15 and we will head in for seats as soon as they let us.  This is the IMAX version and will be showing downstairs.  This is a larger theater, but it makes gathering more difficult.  I will be near the ropes near the concession stand until they let us in.  Sometimes they let us into the inner lobby to wait, sometimes not.  Once they open the doors we will grab seats.    Get there early!!!! It is much more difficult to find and sit with the group when we are in the lower theaters.

In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

Please note, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.  And while it is possible to buy your ticket at the door, shows often sell out. I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance.  Tickets went on sale on Fandango on 10/1/15 and and will probably sell out.  

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

Movie Details:

Release date: November 20, 2015

Studio: Lionsgate

Director: Francis Lawrence

MPAA Rating: N/A

Screenwriter: Danny Strong

Starring: Donald Sutherland, Woody Harrelson, Jeffrey Wright, Josh Hutcherson, Jena Malone, Julianne Moore, Stanley Tucci, Elizabeth Banks, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Jennifer Lawrence, Sam Claflin, Liam Hemsworth

Genre: Drama, Action, Sci-Fi

Official website:

TheHungerGamesmovie.com

Plot Summary:

The epic global phenomenon of "The Hunger Games" arrives at its powerful final chapter with "The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 2" – in which Katniss Everdeen (Jennifer Lawrence) now fully realizes the stakes are no longer just for survival, they are for the future. With the nation of Panem in a full scale war, Katniss Everdeen confronts President Snow (Donald Sutherland) in the final showdown. Teamed with a group of her closest friends – including Gale (Liam Hemsworth), Finnick (Sam Claflin), and Peeta (Josh Hutcherson) – Katniss goes off mission, using the unit from District 13 – and risking their lives – to stage an assassination attempt on President Snow increasingly obsessed with destroying her, the mortal traps, enemies, and moral choices that await Katniss will challenge her more than any arena she faced in The Hunger Games.
results.name: The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - 2 (7:15PM IMAX Show)

results.description:
{We'll gather with our friends and community to practice what is most likely to create personal happiness -- gratitude.  Like any party, we'll chat and eat and enjoy one another, and, in the spirit of PGN and HBS, we'll take time to give thanks for our many blessings.  Bring a friend for whom you are grateful.} 


Our Topic This Evening Will ....

... Celebrate one of the most important holidays for personal growth and positive psychology -- Thanksgiving -- where we put our energy into expanding all the great parts of our life by acknowledging and giving thanks to them.

For what are you thankful?
* For the things you have? 
* For the values and character you have?
* For the experiences you have had? 
* For the people you have (had)?

We'll take the time to remember, especially, those lovely souls and those sweet hearts who have made our lives better: 
* The friend who stood by you when prospects looked bleak; 
* The family member who took your side; 
* The mentor who saw that quality in you before you saw it in yourself; 
* The neighbor on whom you can always count; 
* The provider whom you’re always happy to see; 
* The boss who was so supportive; 
* The customer who infuses meaning to your job; 
* The lover who changed your life for the better; 
* The partner who shares with you their joy, even when you're righteously grumpy.
* The hero who inspires you to even greater steps 


We will express our gratitude in several ways.

And we'll leave this party with the true benefit of thanks-giving -- the feeling of being blessed.


To Bring

This is a potluck dinner party, so bring something easy and tasty to eat.  (If you do not like to prepare or buy food, throw $10 per person in the pot.) 

[Optional]: Bring a friend for whom you are grateful.


To Prepare 

1)  For what material objects are you thankful?  

2) For what modern conveniences are you thankful? 

3) For what experiences are you thankful?  

4) For what people are you thankful?

5) For what characteristics and values of yourself are you thankful? 

6) How have you practice gratitude in your life, and how has it impacted you?  

Our Leader This Evening

This is a Route 128 South community event.  We will share our gratitude with one another.

Links

Most Important:   
  * Other, Upcoming Heartbeat Salons. 
  * Join our Heart Conversation on FaceBook

For Newbies: 
  *  What is a Heartbeat Salon?  
  *  Where are Heartbeat Salons  
  *  Guidelines for Attending a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Hosts: 
  * How to Host a Heartbeat Salon . 
  * Topics to Offer at a Heartbeat Salon .

For Potential Presenters: 
  * How to Present at a Heartbeat Salon .

Your Suggestions: 
  * Give Us Your Ideas (topics, locations, etc) . 

9/03/15

results.description:
Come join us for a tremendous Rock & Roll dance with Rico Barr 's Jump ‘N’ Jive Review.

Rico Barr, New England's Premier Swing and Party Band, has assembled 7 musicians including 3 vocalists to perform Rock, Pop and Ballads.

They perform selections from the Jazz and Rock decades including Motown and R&B, as well as Latin. . The Band’s repertoire includes The History of Popular Dance Music, great Motown & Soul classics by Marvin Gaye, The Temptations, Stevie Wonder, Ray Charles and Billy Paul, and Swing from Michael Buble, Frank Sinatra and Tony Bennett.

http://ricobarr.com/


Over his career, Rico has played with many music legends including jazz great, Joe Newman. Several members of the band have been nominated by The National Swing Awards including Rico on Vocals and Drums, Dave “The Lip” Dubinsky on trumpet, who has performed at The White House and Carl Reppucci, Jr. on keyboard, a featured soloist on the Sea Breeze Jazz Label. Additional band members include guitarist Paul Hanson, a Berklee Faculty Member whose credits include Marlena Shaw, saxophonist Doug Leaffer, who has been described by Jazz Times magazine as a “fine soloist”, acclaimed arranger and trombonist Bob “Cool Breeze” Holfelder and International Jazz Star Dmitry Gorodetsky on bass.


This distinctive event brings together a historic place and a local accomplished band. The combination of the two will present a unique setting in which to dance, make new friends and enjoy private conversations. Step back to the middle of the 19th century and enjoy the music you love.

Directions:  http://stevensestate.com/contact.html

The Rock & Roll Dance will be held on at the Stevens Estate in North Andover, MA. Saturday, November 21. 7 - 11pm,  guests $30. Suits/jackets & ties for men ~ Cocktail attire for women. Dessert, coffee and tea are included. There is a cash bar. Free Parking.

A Lady or Gentleman accompanied by a non-Sitzundjiber MALE friend will receive a COMPLIMENTARY DRINK


Among Rico and the Band’s Highlight Performances and Clients have been The Boston Harbor Festival, Radio Station WZID Christmas at the Palace, Cape Cod Jazz Festival, WNBP Jazz Cruise for the Benefit of the Firehouse Theater, Peabody Essex Museum, Castle Hill, Manchester NH Jazz & Blues Festival, Hampton Beach Seafood Festival, Swinging Under The Stars At Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Ryles Jazz Club, The Acton Jazz Café, Swing City in Cambridge, and Ron DellaChiesa’s Strictly Sinatra Dance Party.

A story slam is a competition based on the art of storytelling. It puts a major emphasis on content and secondary on performance, encouraging storytellers to focus on what they’re saying and how they say it. It is an exercise in crafting stories within a set time limit

We are on the second floor of the office/clubhouse building. If for some reason, the front door isn't propped open, come around the back of the clubhouse, up the outside back stairs to the second floor, where you can enter through the sliding glass door on the deck.

You CAN park along the road or in the "future resident" spots, but please do not take the spots in front of the building next door that are "resident only."

You can bring food and drink. If you want to grab dinner on the way in, there is a good and inexpensive Italian place almost across the street that also does take-out (Linguine's) and there is a Chipotle's nearby but expect to wait in line for 40 minutes on a Friday night. Feel free to bring your own games and snacks/drinks. We do have a small kitchen available to us.

Don't forget - Randy is paying Meetup like $15 a month to run this group. Consider chipping in a couple bucks each year to help defray his costs.

results.description:
Join us for a comedy night out at the Norwood Theatre. The theme is "Parents Night Out". It's about Family, Marriage, Mayhem, and Mini Vans.

National headlining comedians Karen Morgan & Jim Colliton join together in this funny show about parenting, marriage & family. Jim and Karen are both happily married – just not to each other – so they bring both perspectives of parenting to the stage. Through stand-up comedy and hilarious audience participation, Karen and Jim take you on a wild ride through the insane world that is family. Whether you are a parent or you have parents, you will love this show. So get a baby sitter! You deserve a Parents Night Out!


I'm reserving 14 seats 7 and 7 back to back, close to the front. You will need to call the box office [masked]) and buy a ticket under my name Rick Abdou. Tickets are $28 and $25 for ages 60 and up. After you purchase a ticket please RSVP to let us know. I will  see about planning dinner as well and add it in later.

We will be serving TBD Foods take on the classics Turkey, Stuffing, Potatoes, Cranberry Sauce. venue.name: The New England Center for Homeless Veterans

results.description:
I volunteer a couple of times a month serving lunch at the shelter. Great group of men and women who have served our country and have come back needing a little help. The Center, which was started by a Veteran, provides housing, health care, social services, food, as well as a multitude of other services for our returning heroes. They have volunteer groups come in on weekends and do breakfast service. We don't provide the food, just smiles and friendly faces. The serving starts at 7:15am and we would be done by around 9.  We have gone as a group several times and hope to keep this up monthly, there's a limit to 6 servers each time. It's really a wonderful time. Some of the ladies asked about baking/bringing something. I also spoke with the head of the kitchen....just avoid things with nuts because of allergies. Hope to see you all then! We can carpool, it's near the Orange line and if you drive in you can park right in front. Also remember a hat, you need to have your head/hair covered to serve.

 My telephone number if you have any questions or have a last minute change to status is[masked]

2 things:
1. Since this is a popular event, I'd like to ask that you only sign up only if you are able to get up early on a Sunday.  There will be several Sundays throughout the year I'll actually take myself off as well so that opens up one spot. On the days I cook, I'll also open it up to have 7 servers so that more can come.
2. To prevent the # of no shows we've had, I'm going to just let everyone know that if you know show, I will remove you from future volunteer opportunities with the Center. I've hated the times when due to no shows, the Vets have had to step in to help, especially because there are often individuals that were on the wait list and didn't have the opportunity to show. If you cannot attend, please RSVP no ahead of time, or at the very least, just call or text me if you aren't well the morning of the shift, just so I know and can get them to provide help when I get there. My telephone # is[masked]-1526. Those letting me know that they can't make a day ahead of time won't be considered a no show.

Thank you for your ongoing support. I appreciate it and I know that the Veterans do as well.
results.name: Volunteer and serve breakfast at the New England Center for Homeless Veterans

results.description:
Meet to paint the model for a four week pose- Members (those paying the $25 monthly membership fee) may reserve a spot for $65, non-members for $75.    Three hours each Sunday morning, 9:30-12:30.  You can come individual days by paying $15 (members) or $25 (non-members) for a single drop-in, but please consider paying for the full amount and committing to come!  It will help us to keep these long sessions going, and even if you pay for the whole session and don't come to all of them (often happens), you're getting a pretty square deal.  If you would like to pay online please do so at


http://damonlehrer.com/damonlehrer.com/payment.html 

PLEASE TRY TO BE ON TIME-  folks who come later than 10:00 am will be admitted ONLY at the convenience of the host (who is busy painting). PLEASE NOTE THE PRICES BELOW- They are deliberately a bit higher than for drawing sessions as we keep the studio less crowded for painting, and it's more work to put together a four week pose.  

----- IF THE CAPACITY REACHES 12, whether or not that number shows up on the RSVP list, we may have to close the session to further drop-ins to preserve breathing space for those who reserved ahead. ------

 Please consider that for $65 or $75 (non-member) you can reserve ahead for the whole month, which helps us stay open for business.  If you want to drop in, you can RSVP and pay online- simply change the amount of the payment at the payment stage to reflect the drop-in rate above.
results.how_to_find_us: corner of Vernon and Central streets
results.name: Sunday painting

results.description: We will start here in Lunenburg at the Hickory Hills trails and then adventure around central mass for variety. I would like to plan on every Sunday at 9:30, not too early and still leaves you time to do other things. The goal will be to spend 1-2 hours walking on the trails. For clarification the intent is not a nature walk, we will keep a comfortable pace while observing the nature around us. We may from time to time stop to check out a porcupine sighting or other cool nature event. Bring water and a pair of good/comfortable shoes. Good sneakers or hiking shoes or boots. We can park at my house and walk over to one of the trail heads from here. Feel free to pile in the driveway to park.
results.name: Beginner Trail Walking

results.description:
The Classic Hollywood Noir Portrait with strong contrasting black and white tones is one of the iconic images of the last century. Come along to this totally hands-on session and learn how to re-create this look in the studio.

We will have one or more models on hand to pose as we re-create the 1940's Hollywood look using some complex lighting styles.  Grids, snoots, gobos, flags and lighting ratios will all come into play as we attempt to imitate the traditional film-Noir look.

This class is suitable for those who already have a basic understanding of lighting whether that is with spotlights or studio lights and are comfortable with manual  camera settings.  All lighting and remote triggers will be provided.   (Please note that owners of Sony cameras will need to have a flash hotshoe adapter that converts the hotshoe to a standard fitting) .

The class will begin at 10am and run until4pm  (or later if we are not finished)

The class is limited to just six people and the cost is $150
results.how_to_find_us: Enter through the EMTS door and head for the second floor.
results.name: The Classic Hollywood Noir Portrait -  a hands-on workshop

All Levels Welcome

Each time we meet we'll begin with a group meditation. This meditation will focus on joining together all of our energies and those of our guides and non-physical support to create a safe space in which to explore our abilities beyond the 5 senses.
We'll work together as a group on some nights and in smaller groups or in pairs on others.
The focus is on practice and experimentation while we push through our comfort zone into the next level of our own connection with Spirit.

We encourage everyone to join us in our comfortable and judgement-free zone.

*$15 donation will be accepted at the door*

We are going to interpret Joachim Meyer’s Dussak.  The translation we will use is in

The Art of Combat: A German Martial Arts Treatise of 1570 (Hardcover)

http://www.amazon.com/gp/offer-listing/1848327781/ref=sr_1_5_twi_2_har_olp?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1434813702&sr=1-5&keywords=meyer

with additional material from Meyer’s 1560 work

https://sites.google.com/site/jochimmeyer1560/home/Meyer_1560_english_Maurer_2012.pdf?attredirects=0&d=1

From Jakob Sutor’s “New Illustrated Fechtbuch” of 1612

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0Bxqzt-jcOCFsT19Xa1Q2QXltWm8/edit

Finally some from

Cod.Guelf.83.4 Aug.8º


http://www.thearma.org/Manuals/Codex-Guelf-83.4-Aug-8f-translation.pdf
results.name: Dussack, One-handed sword, Interpreting Meyer Dussack

results.description:
One of our group members, Dawnna Weir, has been building a tiny house up near Nashua, NH for the past couple of months, mostly by herself. She's trying to get the roof on before winter comes, and needs some extra help in order to do so!


Dawnna will be working this Sunday, starting at 10am, and invites others who are willing to join in. No previous experience with construction is required, but a willingness to help is! Folks should bring appropriate safety gear (eye protection and gloves). The build site is on a chicken farm, so folks should also wear clothing and shoes that can get a bit muddy. Battery operated tools (drills, etc) are welcome.

This is a good opportunity to see a tiny house in the process of being built, to learn a bit about what the construction process entails, and is a chance to help out someone in our community!
results.name: Tiny House Build -- A Call for Help!

Learn how to follow a trail on a nice day, read a map, or use a compass. Free instruction; easy trails, hard trails or no trails! your choice!

results.description:
This weekend, instead of a guest speaker, we will be having a round table discussion on future of our community, what we want from it, and how we want it to grow from where we are today. We will be discussing plans, venues, fundraising, and more. We will be starting at 10 AM and ending around 11 AM so that those who want to attend the two-year anniversary of Sunday Assembly Boston can do so.

This will be a chance to shape the path of the Boston Oasis community, and we invite both those who have been a part of the community as well as those who are interested in becoming a part of it, to be a part of the conversation!

=========================================

Oasis meets in the Teen Center at the YMCA. To find the room, enter through the lower entrance (on Dartmouth Street, by the swimming pool), and follow Oasis signs from the front lobby to the Teen Center on the second floor. (Note: the stairwell to the Teen Center is NOT the stairwell in the front lobby. That is Stairwell A. The Teen Center is located at Stairwell B, next to the Yoga Studio. Oasis volunteers will be available to help provide assistance, and signage will be posted.

=========================================

Greater Boston Oasis is a secular community dedicated to providing for the human need for social and intellectual community, for those people who may not want or be able to have those needs met in a church or other faith-based community. 

Our Core Values are:

People are more important than beliefs


Reality is known through reason


Meaning comes from making a difference


Human hands solve human problems


Be accepting, and be accepted

Atheist or agnostic, freethinker or skeptic, deist or theist, all those with whom those values resonate are welcome to celebrate the human experience.
results.how_to_find_us: Follow signs from the entrance to the Teen Center room. Use the Dartmouth Street entrance, and head to Stairwell B. Teen Center is on the 2nd floor.
results.name: Sunday Gathering: Round Table Discussion: "What do we want Oasis to be & do?"

results.description:
This is a fabulous shopping experience.  DiDi Original Biscotti will have a table at this event.

You will need to use the below link to register.  Admission is free !!

http://northshoreemporium.com

Sorry, we are not a holiday craft fair. Think of it more as a vibrant marketplace nestled in the rooms of a beautiful historic mansion.

This event is a celebration of food + gifts made by local passionate individuals (we consider them courageous, as well). We’ve procured over 40 deliciously talented makers and have brought them together for a day of tasting + shopping.

Who knew there were so many talented entrepreneurs in our midst? Honestly, we feel like this area has some pretty awesome local businesses. Why not create an event to celebrate them + showcase their goods?! Boom . . . the North Shore Food + Gift Emporium is born.

Come taste + shop from 45 local food + fine gift makers—even more than last year! Sweet, savory, salty, spicy, crunchy, chewy, colorful, festive, shiny, fragrant, unique . . . you name it, we’ll have it. This event is designed to bring out the fun lovin’ foodie + savvy shopper in everybody.

Hosted at the gorgeous historic Willowdale Estate in Topsfield, the North Shore Food + Gift Emporium will be the perfect event to get a head start on your—dare we say—holiday shopping. But don’t be dismayed, you’ll easily find something for everyone on your list . . . including something for yourself!

http://northshoreemporium.com
results.name: North Shore Food and Gift Emporium

results.description:
A unique event where you can taste + shop from local makers. It's not a craft fair, but more like a vibrant marketplace. The venue is the gorgeous historical Willowdale Estate in Topsfield. This is a perfect event to gather with friends before the busy holiday season, accomplish a ton of shopping, and discover a bunch of cool foods + gifts made locally. All of the vendors are showcased on the website.

Event website :: www.NorthShoreEmporium.com
results.name: Let's check out the North Shore Food + Gift Emporium

group.name: Bostons North Shore Arts and Dining Meetup

results.description:
It's my pleasure to personally invite you to the North Shore Food + Gift Emporium. Taste + shop from 45 local makers of fine foods + gifts. Hosted at the gorgeous historic Willowdale Estate in Topsfield, MA.


My friend Lauren + I have worked all year to procure the most deliciously talented vendors for our event. No, this is not a holiday craft fair. Think of it more as a gourmet marketplace.

Since each of you share an appreciation for good food + flavors, I wholeheartedly believe that you'll LOVE this event. Get ready to be blown away by the passion + talent of these local entrepreneurs!

With there being over 130 "Cookbook Collectors" in the group, I'm eager to meet each + every one of you. It would mean so much to have you attend my event (it's free).

If you come, please find me and and say "Hi." Or better yet, give me a "high five" to signify your being a member of Feast! It'll be our fun little secret club thing. ;-)

All the info you need is at www.NorthShoreEmporium.com. The event is on Facebook in case you want to invite your local friends. Either way, I hope you can make it. If not, I'll look forward to meeting you at a future Feast event.

Thanks everyone!

Warmly,
Jessica

p.s. Below is the perfect itinerary for you:

11:15 a.m. • Arrive at Willowdale to attend event (eat a light breakfast)


11:30 a.m. • First stop . . . the Sitting Room (entrance on the left side of the foyer) to meet + greet Maggie Battista, the founder of EatBoutique.com and local author. From 10-12, she'll be selling + signing her recently launched cookbook, "Food Gift Love"

12:00 p.m. • Explore the event. Meet, sample, and shop from our amazing vendors. Say hi to me. Save the Conservatory room for last. Read the next bullet to find out why...


2:00 p.m. • In middle the Conservatory (room with the glass walls + ceiling) is my friend Dougy of Shubies in Marblehead. He will be offering tips + tricks to build the best cheese boards for your parties. I love his passion for cheese and insisted on him being a part of out event.

2:30 p.m. • On your way out, stop back in the Sitting Room to meet with our 2nd featured author . . . Heather Atwood! Does that name sound familiar? Yep, her cookbook, "In Cod We Trust" was our featured book for our inaugural Feast back in October. From 1-3 p.m. she'll be signing + selling copies of her amazing cookbook. The first recipe you'll want to try is her flour-less Chocolate Mousse Cake (would you agree, Tammy?). I still have dreams about that cake. It'll make a wonderful addition to your holiday dessert repertoire. Either way, pop in and meet Heather! You'll see why I love her, dearly.

3:00 p.m. • If you really enjoyed the free sampling of the rum from Privateer Rum (located in Ipswich), then you + your friends should drive to downtown Ipswich to SALT Kitchen + Rum Bar. They have some fun cocktails with Privateer Rum! While you're there, say Hi to Chef/Owner Dave Gillis. Tell him, Jessica Brand sent you! He's been in my Dinner Dealer deck of cards for a couple of years. He's one of my faves.

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •


Event Website •  www.NorthShoreEmporium.com

View + Share on Facebook Here

• • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • •
results.name: North Shore Food + Gift Emporium

results.description:
City Girl Cafe is Yelp's #2 brunch location in Cambridge, and one of the most affordable!  During high season, getting a table here can be a real challenge, but hopefully around the holidays we'll have luck and a short line!  If you're new to the group, try to come- the brunch series has proven a ton of fun.

I know it's a bit far from the T, but hopefully you can make the trek!  If you'd like to come but won't be able to make it given T issues, I'm happy to organize an Uber for those of us willing to meet up at Porter!  If you'd like that, send me an message when you RSVP yes and plan to be at Porter by 10:25.

http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Tq8Yc0aE77w/Tlp8PnpfOOI/AAAAAAAAAtU/eKLV1h80GQw/s1600/IMG_3655.JPG

IMPORTANT: Please note that City Girl Cafe does NOT take reservations, so we'll be waiting in line, and if you show up late and can't get a spot, there's nothing we can do about that! So be on time. We may have to wait a little while in line as well.

RSVP: Please RSVP if you plan to come. If you RSVP, I'll be waiting to hear from you, so please show up, or let me know if circumstances change! If you ditch us more than once, we'll have to remove you from the group. When you RSVP, you're making a commitment and taking a spot, so come. If you need to get a hold of me, my number is four four zero 488-5055.
results.name: Brunch Series #6: City Girl Cafe

results.description:
Ok, so you want to make a difference in the world. (Hopefully a positive one.)

There are lots of ways you can do it. There are an incredible number of charities you can support, socially-useful career paths you can follow, and volunteer opportunities in your community. I'm reliably informed that you can even make people happy by being nice to them.

If you want to make a positive difference, it's easy. But if you care how MUCH of a positive difference you make, you're faced with the challenge of choosing between your options. And that's not easy at all.

__

Jesse Galef does outreach for the Centre for Effective Altruism and will be focusing on developing local communities. He served as program manager and press officer for the Future of Life Institute, which promotes research and investigation into ensuring that powerful technology is beneficial to humanity. Prior to moving to Boston, he spent six years working for the secular movement, including time at the Secular Student Alliance, the Secular Coalition for America, and a few hectic months as publicity director for the Reason Rally.

Should be able to have a good grasp of skills (passing, setting, hitting) and be able to move around to cover areas of the court. Play should consistently be bump-set-spike. If you'd like to play, please do the following: Click RSVP or send an email to Alan using the following URL:

http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=186541038

Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. We will do our best to make sure the event is co-ed, have setters, and incorporate a couple new members who want to join as well. The location for this volleyball meetup is at the JCC of the North Shore, 4 Community Road, Marblehead, MA[masked] | Home Page:

http://www.jccns.org/adult-volleyball/

This event is free if you are a member of JCC. If not, it's a one-time $8 membership fee that is valid for a day. As always, please remember: - Respect the RSVP system (Don't show up expecting to play without a confirmed RSVP) - If it looks like you won't be able to make it or will run late please cancel your RSVP in time for someone else to join. Event day/last minute cancellations and no shows will jeopardize your participation in future events.

results.description:
These sessions at The Chinatown Community Center/Josia School will focus on a 6 week rotating schedule of classes designed to introduce the basics of Parkour in concentrate classes. The schedule will follow in order: 

• Safety, Landings and Balance

Class 1 will be focusing on how to land, move and stay safe practicing Parkour outdoor and in the real world. 

• Vaulting

Class 2 will focus on the foundation of Parkour - getting over low-level obstacles fast and efficiently through the use of vaulting.

• Precisions

Class 3 will focus on accuracy of jumping and foot/eye coordination honing basic standing and running jumps.

• Wall Techniques 

Class 4 will focus on conquering obstacles too large or tall to vault, in tandem with using walls as a means to keep a more efficient run.

• Tumbling/Acro

Class 5 focus is on tumbling and acrobatic skills, in pursuit of fully understanding movement in a 3D space and total proprioception.

• Flow + Speed

Class 6 links together all the previous lessons into one cohesive movement, and a timed obstacle course setting.

------

What if I've never done anything like Parkour before?  

This class, Parkour 101, is a introductory level class. We will be focusing more on learning how to move our body, understand our limits and get a solid understanding of how to train safe rather than jumping straight into super-high level flips and jumps. 

What if I'm a gymnast/marine/stuntman/etc? I don't want to be bored.

Our program prides itself on scaling classes to each and every student. With something like Parkour there are many levels and progressions to each movement. It's very common to in the same class have one student working on perfecting their roll, and on the other side of the room have another student practicing very high-level acrobatics. They both come from the same foundation, but are scaled to each practitioners skill level. 

What do I need to bring/prepare?

The great thing about Parkour is its accessibility. You really only need a good pair of shoes. We recommend a shoe that is made for urban running (no aggressive treads, a smoother sole lightweight). Think hiking boots, crocs, skate shoes are all no-nos. 

Other than that, dress appropriately for activity. Shorts, sweats, t-shirts are all good here. Jeans are normally not the best choice. 

We highly recommend bringing water, snacks and a form of transportation (bike, longboard, potentially train fare)

We will be charging a $5 per class fee to start here, and for the 1 hour 15 minute class we think this isn't too ridiculous. We accept cash or card day of. 

Anything else?

These jams will be run outdoors, and with existing architecture. While we won't be getting into anything crazy, injuries are to be expected. Scrapes happen. We will have first aid available, but make sure you are thinking clearly and in your limits before training! 

I am available to answer all questions, but I hope to see a whole bunch of you out in a few weeks!! 

Be sure to check us out on:

https://www.facebook.com/ParkourAndTricking

https://instagram.com/projectfreerun 

http://www.projectfreerun.com/
results.name: [Boston] Parkour 101 - Introduction to Parkour //

results.description:
Massive Bowling/Pool/Skeeball/Shuffleboard Extravaganza!

Hey everyone!

It's time again for our big monthly bowling event at Kings! We always have a great time and we always pack the place. If you've attended before, you know THIS EVENT IS AWESOME, RIGHT?! Of course you do!

FAQ:

Q: Is this really free? 
A: Yes! It's really free!

- Free Bowling! 
- Free Shoe Rentals! 
- Free Pool! 
- Free Skeeball! 
- Free Shuffleboard!

Q: Can I bring my kids? 
A: Yes! Kids are welcome! I usually have lanes 1 & 2 set up with bumpers for them.

Q: What's the best way to get there? 
A: Honestly, taking the T is. See the Getting There section below. 

Q: C'mon, is this really free? What's the catch? 
A: Yes, it's really all free and there is no catch! Simply put, I'm awesome. lol : )

RSVP now!

RSVP ETIQUETTE

1. This is a really popular event, and we do count the RSVP's for this, so please RSVP in one group only, as this allows for an accurate count and staff is hired according to this number.

2. RSVP RESPONSIBLY! There are many people in the habit of no-showing and it hurts these events! Don't be that person! Only RSVP if you can go and update your RSVP if you can't make it. You fellow group members and organizers are counting on you to show up. : )

❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤

Get ready for a great time with Boston's best socialites!

See you there… :)

~Matt

P.S. We have the entire Royal Room and bowling lanes 1-10 for this event! Find us inside!

❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤

Getting There:

Taking The T: You can get off at the Hynes Convention Center on the B, C, & D Green Line trains and walk the 2 blocks over, or you can get off at the Prudential Mall station on the E Green Line train and walk through the Pru and the Sheraton to get there.

Driving: Parking can be tough and expensive. There is a garage right next door, but it's $29. You can find on street parking, but that's tough on Sunday mornings. If you want to drive and park, I suggest you get to the area 30-45 minutes early and start looking. Newbury, Hereford, Boylston, and Scotia Streets are all places I look and find parking.

<a href="http://photos1.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/6/6/a/highres_337662602.jpeg"></a>

results.description:
For those who are already vegan or are moving toward a more plant-based way of eating. 

This is not a food event, just great conversation. 

Look for the discussion group in the conference room. 

Attendees are expected from Vegan Metrowest Meetup, Boston Vegan Meetup, and the congregation. 

This month the group will have Annie Bernhard, a master's level nutritionist who was recently certified in one of the nutritional outreach programs of the Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine!  www.PCRM.org

Meeting site is on the bus line from Harvard Square.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Annie Bernhard passes along her veganism-for-the-win article of the day, about how a high-fiber diet supports, and can to some extent restore, the microbial communities in our guts. 
On the other hand, a high-meat diet decimates them. 

She offers as one of her favorite lines: 
"If you eat minimally processed plants, which humans have for millions of years, you cannot avoid fiber." 

http://nautil.us/issue/30/identity/how-the-western-diet-has-derailed-our-evolution
results.name: Vegan Conversations (with PCRM-certified Vegan Nutritionist)

results.description:
A volksmarch is a noncompetitive 3.1 mile (5 km) or 6.2 mile (10 km) walk. It's not a pledge walk, it's not a race, it is a fun activity you do with a club, with your family, with your pet, or all by yourself. Volksmarching got its name from its origins in Europe. I'm not sure of the Worlds end distance - I'll measure it on this trip.

World's End in Hingham is a great place to hike along the coastline.
Rolling hills and rocky shorelines offer sweeping views of the Boston skyline, while tree-lined carriage paths designed by famed landscape architect Frederick Law Olmsted.

It’s the tree-lined carriage paths and sweeping views of the Boston skyline, only 15 miles away. The 251-acre coastscape includes rocky shores, broad hillsides, and open fields bracketed by pockets of woodlands.

Hingham Beerworks is part of the Boston Beerworks chain of brewpubs. Great food and crafted on site beer make this a great spot for a post hike lunch. This particular location also offers the best view of any of the BeerWorks, overlooking Hingham Harbor.
We'll start at Noon, get some hiking in and enjoy the views, and head to Hingham BeerWorks for some lunch around 2:30.

Let's meetup in the World's End main parking lot. Follow Martin's Lane to the entrance, you will need to check in at the Ranger Station and pay a $5 per person admission fee. The Ranger can direct you to the parking lot, or check out the map at the link given below.

Update:

Also we have a lot of people so if possible please car pool since it is a small parking lot. In Downtown Hingham. I was told there is a public parking lot near their beach can anyone meet there at 11am and organize a carpool and head over.

For more information and a menu, check out the following links:

http://www.thetrustees.org/places-to-visit/greater-boston/worlds-end.html
http://www.hinghamlaunch.com/directory

Addresses:

World's End: Martin’s Lane Hingham, MA 02043
Latitude:[masked] Longitude: [masked]
Hingham BeerWorks: In the Shipyard 18 Shipyard Drive, Hingham, MA 02043
results.how_to_find_us: Look for my Burgundy Toyota Minivan and Call or text me 508-479-7690
results.name: World's End Volksmarch & Beerworks (Hingham)

results.description:
Taking advantage of the quieter times at BKBS, this is the bouldering-focused meetup on Sunday afternoons. A chance to have a bit of a more sociable group so we can hit some boulder problems accompanied by the tips, encouragement and occasional piss-taking of your fellow BKBSers. (roped climbing is also an option if you're keen, of course)


Meet at the first table as you enter the gym, just opposite the changing rooms. If you know that you'll be late, let us know in the comments section, and maybe tell us what you'll be wearing, so we can look out for you. 

Note: We've been fairly sparsely attended recently, and a couple of times I've been the only person there. Rather than cancel entirely I'll leave this open, but be aware that it may end up being a looser collection of people than the Wednesday meeting. Feel free to PM me if there's only one or two RSVPs and you want to confirm I'll be there.

These are the climbing rates:

ADMISSION (Full day use, you can leave and come back!): 

Day Pass - $25 (Students $20) 
10 Pack - $225 (Students $180)

(Membership Pricing also available)

RENTALS: 

Shoes - $5 
Harness - $5 
Chalk Bag - $2 
Full Gear Kit - $11
results.name: Brooklyn Boulders Sunday Bouldering

John and I invite you to join us on Sunday November 22nd for a pre turkey day potluck dinner at our house in Hudson.  We will start with appetizers at 12:00, followed by dinner around 2:00, which will give us plenty of time to visit and have a drink or two before the feast. 

We will make a turkey, of course, and also a spiral ham.  I know you all must have a  traditional or favorite holiday dish, appetizer or dessert, which we would all love to try, so please add a comment and let us all know what you will be bringing.   This will eliminate duplicate items and also allow everyone to see what is still needed for the feast. 

I have limited this event, so please be sure to update your RSVP if your plans change and you are no longer able to attend, so other can attend.

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE: Our weekend MJ sessions are usually in Saugus, not Danvers.

Please RSVP for this event so we can be sure to grab enough tables and bring enough Mah Jongg sets!  Newcomers to American style Mah Jongg are welcome! Thanks!

Note that MJ is usually played with 4 people, although it can be played with 2 or 3 as well, with some adjustment to the rules. If the number of RSVPs is not a multiple of 4, then we can decide whether to have multiple tables or have some sit out of some games and observe OR play a rack with another person. (This is a great way to learn!)
results.name: Sunday afternoon, in Saugus

results.description:
Last walk for 2015 !    I thought I'd try one more walk again before  the holidays.  We will walk around the Ashland Reservoir on Sunday.  We will be done around 3PM .   Rain cancels-- but its looking pretty good as of today. I'll cancel by 10AM  if  need be. 

Meet at the Senior Center parking lot- 162 W Union for GPS (this is Rt 135) If any interest,  we can grab a bite afterwards, seeing as it's the last walk!   Remember,  Trails  tend to be muddy in parts.
results.name: Ashland State Park walk  this Sunday

results.description:
Here's the game plan:

1:00 - Toss the disc around, meet folks, be merry

1:10 - Overview of the rules, safety, etc - then divide into teams

1:20 - Play!!!!!!

3:00 - Conclude the meetup with snacks and socializing


Here's what we humbly ask of you (works great as a checklist):

Dress for the weather

Bring a white t-shirt and a colored t-shirt. Grey is evil. If you wear grey you may be asked to wear a dark or white "pinnie of shame."

Arrive on time to be guaranteed a spot in a game

RSVP is recommended so you can be notified if the game is canceled

Bring WATER!

If you are a regular, please consider bringing a buck for the Frisbee Fund

As usual, we will supply the frisbees, cones, pinnies, sunscreen, first aid supplies (hopefully will never be used) and our pretty smiles. As we periodically mention, all these supplies are paid out-of-pocket by your loving Frisbee organizers and everyone has been so generous with their donations to-date. Thank you and let's keep the dream alive!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be on the turf fields behind the playhouse. Look for people with light up discs!
results.name: Sunday Afternoon @ Russell Field

results.description:
Join Laura Mattei, SVT's Director of Stewardship, for a walk along these trails to learn about forest ecology and how overabundant deer populations negatively impact the future of our forests. SVT has observed significant changes in the woods at Cowassock due to deer over browsing.

Please register at svtweb.org/programs
results.name: Trail Walk at Cowassock Woods: Deer and Forest Ecology, Framingham/Ashland

results.description:
Many secular people stay away from meditation because of its association with religion. In the mindfulness group at the Humanist Community at Harvard, we have carefully secularized meditation practices so that one can gain the benefits of meditation without having to participate in unwanted religious rituals.

Rick Heller is the author of the new book, Secular Meditation: 32 Practices for Cultivating Inner Peace, Compassion, and Joy, based on the meditations he's led at the Humanist Community at Harvard over the last six years.
results.name: Rick Heller: Secular Meditation Book Release Party

group.name: The Humanist Hub in Harvard Square

results.description:
Join us for a reading (and meditation) from Secular Meditation: 32 Practices for Cultivating Inner Peace, Compassion, and Joy — A Guide from the Humanist Community at Harvard.

The book arose out of this very Meetup group, and if have ever attended one of our meditations, you helped contribute to the creation of the book. The book presents meditations we've done in the group and reflects our discussions after the meditations. It includes the personal stories of several members of the group who agreed to interviews and was written by Rick Heller, who frequently leads group meditation.

The book has been endorsed by a number of meditation teachers, including Stephen Batchelor, Sharon Salzberg, Tara Brach and Rick Hanson. For more information about the book, see http://www.rickheller.com/books/ From the book's description on Amazon:

Meditation is a form of mental exercise with numerous scientifically verified physical and psychological benefits. As meditation teacher Rick Heller shows, meditation's benefits extend beyond the personal to enrich relationships with others, with one's community, and with the world. In Secular Meditation, step-by-step instructions, personal stories, and provocative questions teach empathy for others, stress reduction, and the kind of in-the-moment living that fosters appreciation for life and resilience in the face of adversity. Heller simplifies what is often found mysterious, describing and providing detailed instructions for 32 different practices, ensuring that anyone can find the right one.

Heller simplifies what is often found mysterious -- "If you have ever loved or even liked another person, you have the prerequisites for learning kindness meditation" -- and invites all to partake in "awe and wonder at the rich experience of being alive."
results.name: Secular Meditation Book Party

results.description: Let's make the most of the fall weather before we get snowed in! Meet up at 1:30PM at the Arnold Arboretum in Jamaica Plain for a walk. Feel free to bring your partner(s) and/or friends to the event. The Arboretum is accessible by public transportation and I've found parking on many of the side streets in the area. Friendly dogs are welcome to join. We will be bringing our pup (Luna). There are a lot of cafes, restaurants and bars in the area should people want to continue hanging out after the walk.
results.name: A walk in the Arnold Arboretum

group.name: Northshore MA Pathfinder and Pathfinder Society Meetup

results.description:
Hello!

This continues to be tons of fun, so we're going to go another round!

We have plenty of boards and stone, no need to bring your own.

We have water, tea, beer, etc. We will coordinate dinner in the evening.

There is also a convenience store right up the street and a ton of restaurants in the area to satisfy any miscellaneous snacking needs. Any brought snacks are appreciated!

Getting here / the place

We are about a 15 minute walk from the Davis Square t-station. There is parking on the street, which is free on Sundays and usually open. There is also a bus stop for 87, 88, and 89 about 3 minutes away.

We have a safe place to store bikes.

Full disclosure: We have 3 cats, just in case you are allergic or adverse!

Contact

Feel free to get a hold of me at [masked] or give me a call / text at[masked]
results.how_to_find_us: There are two houses numbered 70 on Clarendon Ave because the road runs through Somerville and into Cambridge. The road is one way in Somerville and two ways in Cambridge. We are on the Cambridge side closer to Mass Ave.
results.name: [CAMBERVILLE] Play more go!

results.description:
Let's learn guitar in a fun group setting!

Players of all levels from beginner through intermediate+ are encouraged to attend. 

Any questions? Let me know at [masked].

Your host, Grey, is an international guitar teacher and founder of HubGuitar.com. Grey is a graduate of Berklee College of Music.

1. Please bring your own guitar. There are sometimes extras available to use but it's better to bring your own. You cannot learn guitar without your own guitar to practice at home! If you have questions about getting a guitar, ask at [masked].

2. Nothing else is needed. Just bring your guitar!

3. No experience is required. This is a beginner-level class. 

4. The class is one hour.

5. Please arrive ~5 minutes early. Late arrivals are disruptive and unfair to the learners who arrived on time, and so if you arrive late you may not be admitted to the class (depending on the teacher's discretion). 

6. This class is ideal for beginners. If you have more experience than this, you should consider booking a free trial private lesson instead: http://hubguitar.com/boston
results.name: Beginner Class (Group Setting)

results.description:
Intermediate level : Players with a good understanding of volleyball strategy and a good grasp of volleyball skills. Games require consistent bump, set, spike rallies. Therefore players should have good passing, setting and hitting skills. To ensure a quality level of play, preference will be given to players that are familiar with 5-1 or 6-2.  Please let me know which position(s) your prefer in your RSVP email. If you are not sure about your level or have any questions about this meetup please email the event host.


INSTRUCTIONS: If you'd like to play, please do the following:

1. Send an email to Valerie using the following URL: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=12551965<a href="http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=12551965"></a>

There is a strict cap to make sure everyone gets lots of playing time. Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email.

Please respect the RSVP system. If you are RSVPed "YES" and fail to show or are repeatedly late to the meetups you will not be added to future meetups.

The cost of the meetup will be $5. Please pay the organizer when you arrive before the meetup starts. The money goes to cover the cost of the court rental. The entrance to the gym is on Cambridge Street opposite Harvard Market. The nearest intersection to the entrance is Cambridge Street and Roberts Road. The nearest T stop is Harvard Square. The gym is about a ten minute walk from the T stop. Parking near the school on Sundays is generally easy to find, as meters and residential parking rules are generally not enforced on Sundays (parking signs should say "EX SUNDAY" or similar).

Low Intermediate - Players are able to serve, bump, and set the ball consistently, but may be working on improving passing ability and proficiency at attacking. Players should be familiar with 4-2 formation (middle front setter). 


Spots will be filled in until the meetup reaches capacity at 12, with effort made to keep the level of play consistent from week to week. The waitlist is limited to 5 people.

INSTRUCTIONS: Low-intermediate & Intermediate players send an email using this link to Anja: http://www.meetup.com/volleyball-122/message/?recipientId=128841672

There is a strict cap to make sure everyone gets lots of playing time. Note that sending an email does not guarantee a spot to play; spots are only guaranteed if you receive a positive confirmation email. 

The entrance to the gym is on Cambridge Street opposite Harvard Market. The nearest intersection to the entrance is Cambridge Street and Roberts Road. The gym is about a ten minute walk from the T stop at Harvard Square. Parking meters and residential parking rules are not enforced on Sundays.


The cost of the meetup is $5. Please pay the organizer when you arrive before the meetup starts. The money goes to cover the cost of the court rental.


RSVP policy:

* If you show up without a "Yes" RSVP, you will not be guaranteed to get playing time.


* Please be serious about RSVP's. If you RSVP "Yes" and don't show up, it means you have prevented someone else from attending. 

* Please change your RSVP as soon as possible if you find out you cannot play. Please also change your RSVP to "no" if you are waitlisted, so only available players are bumped up if someone else cancels. Otherwise someone else might end up with too little advance notice to make it to the game.

Anyone who changes their RSVP to "no" less than 24 hours before start time will be counted as a no-show. 

No shows will be given lower priority for a spot next time.

results.description:
I hope you will like the November book selection.  I heard high praises about this book from YA librarians in my area.  If Peter Pan lived today, I imagine he would be the male equivalent of the "Manic Pixie Dream Girl".

There will be a voluntary $1 donation to Gabby to help defray the cost of the meetup.


Before Peter Pan belonged to Wendy, he belonged to the girl with the crow feather in her hair...

Fifteen-year-old Tiger Lily doesn't believe in love stories or happy endings. Then she meets the alluring teenage Peter Pan in the forbidden woods of Neverland and immediately falls under his spell.

Peter is unlike anyone she's ever known. Impetuous and brave, he both scares and enthralls her. As the leader of the Lost Boys, the most fearsome of Neverland's inhabitants, Peter is an unthinkable match for Tiger Lily. Soon, she is risking everything—her family, her future—to be with him. When she is faced with marriage to a terrible man in her own tribe, she must choose between the life she's always known and running away to an uncertain future with Peter.

With enemies threatening to tear them apart, the lovers seem doomed. But it's the arrival of Wendy Darling, an English girl who's everything Tiger Lily is not, that leads Tiger Lily to discover that the most dangerous enemies can live inside even the most loyal and loving heart.

From the New York Times bestselling author of Peaches comes a magical and bewitching story of the romance between a fearless heroine and the boy who wouldn't grow up

If you have a book recommendation, please comment on this meetup page or fill out our survey.  Thank you!

Bookclub Survey

So this was me reading the book.

-Mel
results.how_to_find_us: We will be waiting up front. If you cannot find us, text me at 781 325 8776.
results.name: Drunk YA Bookclub - Tiger Lily by Jodi Lynn Anderson

results.description:
It might be getting chilly outside, but that's not a reason to stay home when you can go ice skating with friends, right? Join us for the public skate session from 2-4pm at the Ed Burns Arena in Arlington Heights. 

Where

Ed Burns Arena Ice Skating Rink [info page]

422 Summer St, Arlington, MA

Cost


Admission to the rink is $6 for adults. If you need skates, rentals are available for $5.

Getting there

If you need a ride or would like to carpool, please post in the comments below. 

Also, the ice rink is about a 10-min walk from the 77 bus stop on Mass Ave.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
